intro: Trichilia dazae, commonly known as the African sand apple, is a small to medium-sized tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other valuable timber species. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in clusters. Its fruit is a smooth, fleshy drupe that turns red when ripe, containing a single seed. Trichilia dazae is often found in dry woodland and savanna habitats, where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
